question: Many people believe that we should protect all wild animals while others believe we should just protect some of them.Discuss both views and give your opinion.
text: There is no doubt that a large number of creatures are critically endangered. While animal activists think that every living thing should be protected before they have vanished from the earth, others consider only harmless ones require this service. In my opinion, I firmly reiterate the former's view since we all are part of a food-chain.

There are many people who think it is crucial to protect animals, especially, those who live in the forest and I support this standpoint. In other words,  this ensures a stable eco-system where  living things are inter-dependent. For example, if  the grasshopper extinct from the earth, this will lead the death of other organisms that consume this such as-frog such as-frog, beetles etcetera. Therefore, ecologists instruct mankind to preserve our  nature for our own existence.

However, opponents of the above-mentioned argument, opine that even though it is  necessary to protect organisms, only selected groups are deserved this. This is because they believe that the majority of them are cruel or cause damage to human beings. For instance, snakes, these are deadly poisonous and kill thousands of victims globally. Similarly, spending a huge amount for this mission seems to be irrelevant, according to them, so they deny to get into the action to protect the entire animal kingdom.

In conclusion, people have a different viewpoint on the protection of animals. When a group think that every wild creature must fall into this category, the opposite  believe that selected organisms need to  be assisted. I personally consider the former is right as every life is counted.
